[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/combinatorial_tests/delta_tests.rs] [Function: run_transactions_deltas()] [Proptest Seed] The test creates a `TestRunner::default()` for property-based testing. [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/combinatorial_tests/delta_tests.rs] [Function: run_transactions_deltas()] [Generation Strategy] The test uses `generate_universe_and_transactions()` with specific parameters. [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/combinatorial_tests/delta_tests.rs] [Function: run_transactions_deltas()] [Thread Pool Sharing] The executor_thread_pool is created once and shared across all iterations. [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/combinatorial_tests/delta_tests.rs] [Function: run_transactions_deltas()] [Thread Pool Configuration] The thread pool is created with `create_executor_thread_pool()` without visible configuration. [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/combinatorial_tests/delta_tests.rs] [Function: run_transactions_deltas()] [Mixed Operations] Transactions are generated with `materialize_with_deltas(..., false)` where the third parameter disallows deletions. Does the test cover scenarios where transactions mix delta operations with regular writes to the same key, potentially causing conflicts or race conditions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/combinatorial_tests/delta_tests.rs] [Function: run_transactions_deltas()] [Delta Application Order] When multiple transactions in a block apply deltas to the same key, is the order of delta application deterministic and properly tested? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/combinatorial_tests/delta_tests.rs] [Function: run_transactions_deltas()] [Baseline Correctness] The baseline is generated with `BaselineOutput::generate(txn_provider.get_txns(), maybe_block_gas_limit)`. [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/combinatorial_tests/delta_tests.rs] [Function: run_transactions_deltas()] [Gas Limit in Baseline] When maybe_block_gas_limit is Some, does baseline generation properly simulate gas exhaustion and skip transactions, or could mismatches between baseline and parallel execution gas accounting be missed? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/combinatorial_tests/delta_tests.rs] [Function: run_transactions_deltas()] [Overflow Handling] When delta operations are applied that could cause integer overflow (e.g., adding to a value near u128::MAX), does the test verify that proper error handling occurs, or could overflow lead to wraparound and incorrect values? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/combinatorial_tests/delta_tests.rs] [Function: run_transactions_deltas()] [Underflow Handling] When delta subtraction operations could cause underflow (e.g., subtracting from zero), does the test ensure proper rejection, or could underflow lead to incorrect negative values or maximum value wraparound? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/combinatorial_tests/delta_tests.rs] [Function: run_transactions_deltas()] [Delta Max Value] Delta operations are generated with a max value parameter. [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/combinatorial_tests/delta_tests.rs] [Function: run_transactions_deltas()] [Determinism Guarantee] The test assumes parallel execution should match sequential baseline output.
